creator: kurt.devlin@thomson.com
text:
The CvsChageLog task ignores the command line -quiet (-q) option.

---
Actual results are:
$ ${ANT_HOME}/bin/ant -q -f cvs-change-log.xml
[cvschangelog] cvs server: Logging .
[cvschangelog] cvs server: Logging documentation
[cvschangelog] cvs server: Logging java
[cvschangelog] cvs server: Logging lib
[cvschangelog] cvs server: Logging scripts
[cvschangelog] cvs server: Logging xml
[cvschangelog] cvs server: Logging xsl

BUILD SUCCESSFUL
Total time: 1 second
---
Expected results are:
$ ${ANT_HOME}/bin/ant -q -f cvs-change-log.xml

BUILD SUCCESSFUL
Total time: 1 second
---

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
I suspect CVS is writing this output to stderr, if so, I don't see a good way to see the difference between this output and real error output that should be visible even with -q.

Need to check before I close this report.

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
Yes:

stefan@v30161:/tmp/testoutput> cvs log > /dev/null
cvs log: Logging ant module 2
cvs log: Logging ant module 2/.svn
cvs log: Logging ant module 2/.svn/prop-base
cvs log: Logging ant module 2/.svn/props
cvs log: Logging ant module 2/.svn/text-base
cvs log: Logging ant module 2/.svn/tmp
cvs log: Logging ant module 2/.svn/tmp/prop-base
cvs log: Logging ant module 2/.svn/tmp/props
cvs log: Logging ant module 2/.svn/tmp/text-base
cvs log: Logging ant module 2/.svn/tmp/wcprops
cvs log: Logging ant module 2/.svn/wcprops

so the output goes to stderr and Ant thinks it is saying something important.
